Speaker: uberman
Dialogue: You look so peaceful from up here.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: I hate the outfits. I mean, I get it: we're all supposed to be "masterminds" - very clever.  I just feel stupid. I mean, what the hell did Einstein really do anyway?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Theory of relativity.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Well, you'd think he'd invent a wool sweater that didn't itch so much.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: The real Einstein once said, "God does not play dice with the world." He was right, because the world is MY dice. Is that understood?

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Alright, then - clean slate. Do we have the girl?

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: Yes, sir. She fell into our trap just like you knew she would.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Reporters are a curious lot, and easily manipulated.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Alright, let's not keep the lady waiting.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You didn't need to turn around like that. I can recognize the stench of failure.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I trust you gentlemen know the very sassy Roxanne Ritchi, highly regarded investigative journalist who some say has a more than friendly relationship with our super powered foe Uberman. And Miss Ritchi, I trust you've already met my new crew: The Mad Geniuses!

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Looks like a real group of winners. At the risk of sounding cliche', you'll never get away with this.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: In a way, I already have.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: We go through this every time. You kidnap me to get to Uberman, he immediately finds your hideout, escapes whatever lame trap you've come up with, and takes you and your cronies to jail. I propose we just save everybody some heartache this time by YOU letting me go, and ME forgetting this whole thing ever happened?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: What about my revenge?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: We can say it was wasting everyone's time.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: You have a wicked tongue. I hope you rid yourself of that when you're my queen.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I'm sorry. What makes you think I would want to be your queen?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Power corrupts absolutely, Miss Ritchi. And when I have ultimate power over this city, I have absolutely every intention of corrupting you with it.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Sir!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: What is it!?

Speaker: uberman
Dialogue: Master Mind!

Speaker: uberman
Dialogue: What's the matter, miss your old jail cell?

Speaker: uberman
Dialogue: You can't possibly believe this will work.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: We're now at minimum safe distance, master.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Excellent. Stop here, I like this view.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Twenty seconds until impact.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Any last words?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Ten seconds to impact.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: uberman
Dialogue: Hold...on...a second.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Seven...

Speaker: uberman
Dialogue: SON OF A BITCH!!

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: What did he just say?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Six......Five...

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: What kind of trick is this?

Speaker: uberman
Dialogue: Like you don't know. These bars are made of copper, aren't they?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Four...

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Yeah, so?

Speaker: uberman
Dialogue: You figured out my weakness, damn you. I CAN'T BEND COPPER!

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Three...

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Your weakness is copper?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Two...one.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: I don't think even he could have survived that.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Whoa! Is it me or did you just finally destroy Uberman?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Well...let's not get ahead of ourselves.

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: Look, there's something in the sky, coming this way.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Uberman!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I KNEW IT! PREPARE YOURSELVES! HE'S GONNA RAM US!!!

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Uberman?

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: You did it!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: ...so I did.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: I mean, I know you always wanted to. I mean, all the schemes all the plots - I never thought you'd actually be capable of it.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: This is history. Every villain and lackey in the history of villains and lackeys dream of this moment, but when does it actually EVER happen?

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Good lord...You do all realize what we get to do now, don't you?

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: We get to go on a crime wave.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Oh, right.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: It's a sport of honor, focus and grace. Honor the ball, focus on the pins, release the ball not hard and fast, but as if you were releasing a baby dove.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Okay, do something like that - but center it more.

Speaker: attractive blond
Dialogue: Tell me how my form looks, honey.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Oh, it's lookin' good. It's lookin' REAL good.

Speaker: vinnie
Dialogue: Now!

Speaker: vinnie
Dialogue: You're fired. Leave your shirt and locker key.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Fired? Are you going to tell me why?

Speaker: vinnie
Dialogue: Showing up to work late. Showing up to work late drunk. Sexually harassing customers. Stealing from the register.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Vinnie, I don't know where you're getting these accusations -

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Oh, which one do you supposedly have here?

Speaker: vinnie
Dialogue: This is all of them at once.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: I've got this one, Benny. So, Cinderella. Can I help you find your glass slipper?

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm looking for a seven.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Seven - Well, maybe I could interest you in something in an EIGHT. Namely, me.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Lesbo.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: From the angle of the camera, I can see where you might have gotten the wrong idea. Listen, Vinnie, I don't think you've thought this through. If you fire me, who's gonna be captain of the alley's bowling team?

Speaker: vinnie
Dialogue: Um, I don't know. Maybe somebody who can actually bowl. You guys have never won a game. I hired you because you said you were on the pro circuit.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: No, I said I WILL BE on the pro circuit.

Speaker: vinnie
Dialogue: Please, a loser like you will never amount to anything.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Wow...If that's how you feel...I guess we should then talk about what kind of severance I'm gonna get.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Hey...what about my ball?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Thank-you!

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: It's...um...It's good to be back. Thanks for everyone's cards and concerns. I really appreciated it - now I'm ready to climb back on the horse.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Someone die or something?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: It's okay.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Come on into my office, sweetie.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Can we get this woman some water for God's sake?  I gave you two months off. What're you doing back? People are gonna think I'm a slave driver.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Aren't you?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yeah, but I don't want people to think it.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Frank, listen. I want to go back to work. I NEED to go back to work.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: ...You're hysterical, aren't you?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: What're you doing?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Keeping you warm before you go into shock.  DO I HAVE SLICE OPEN A CAMEL HUMP TO GET A GLASS OF WATER AROUND HERE?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: It was a traumatic experience. Yes, everyone knows Uberman and me were...close. But what I really need - what would really make me better is getting back to work.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Well, that's going to be...

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I thought you'd be happy to have me back.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Oh, we are. Honey, nothing makes us happier than to have our girl back, but...

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Things have sorta...changed.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: In three weeks?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Listen, I'm not one who likes to open up wounds - especially ones that are just starting to scab, but you were sorta our go to girl for the exclusive on Uberman. And now that he's gone...I moved Brad into your anchor spot.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Brad? Brad Helms? The man is an idiot.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: It's the suits. They think it's time to switch things up.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Oh, because they can't use me to get the big story.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: C'mon, Roxie. Using is in the nature of what we do. They used you, you used Uberman. Everybody's happy.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I didn't use him.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Oh, I didn't mean that. I know you two were in love or something. My bad.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: We were.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: And that's great.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Very in love.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Okay. So, where are they going to move me if Brad has my spot?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: ...Human interest.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Bake sales and pet stories.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I told them I wouldn't be surprised if you just upped and quit. You busted your ass for that desk.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I'll take it.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Just robbed the diamond exchange.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Great, great. Put it on the pile.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Anything else today?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Sir, the new reactor is installed.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Do you want to throw the switch? I know how you love to start reactors.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Maybe later.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Sir, I can't help but notice that you've been...a little down lately.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: When I want your opinion I'll beat it out of you.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Yes, sir, I know, but please forgive my impertinence. It's just that you seem to have lost your lust for our profession. You've stopped going on jobs and spend most of your time watching Uberman specials.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I have defeated my greatest enemy. I have free reign over Metro City. I have more wealth than a thousand Sultans. I've achieved all I have worked for...so why am I so unhappy?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I mean, my father, god rest his evil and tormented soul, raised me straight from the test tube to be a symbol of evil.  And, I have accomplished something he had only dreamed about - the destruction of Metro City's champion. I tell you, I've always lived with this unquenchable thirst. I thought it was to make him proud or to get absolute power. But now that I've pretty much accomplished both, I am at a loss.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: ...I sort of have a theory about all that.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Oh, really?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Well, for one thing, maybe Uberman was more important to you than you thought.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: He was a worthy rival. Sometimes I wonder, did he consider me his evil equal or was I just an annoying, little gnat to him? ...What's the second part?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: I think you sort of have a thing for Roxanne Ritchi.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: YOU WORM! HOW DARE YOU! WHERE WOULD YOU GET SUCH A NOTION?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Sir, your plans always involve Ms. Ritchi either being kidnapped or placed in danger. If that's not love, I don't know what is. It's the grown up equivalent of dipping her pigtails in the ink well. Don't you see? She's the one treasure that's always escaped you.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I just wanted to get back to work.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I keep trying to tell people it wasn't really like that. Uberman and I - We were kinda having problems. We broke up.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Maybe someone who's a little more aware of his faults. Someone a little more sensitive.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Well, until he miraculously comes walking into my life, I'm just going to take a little reflection time for myself.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Who the hell is John Cusack?

Speaker: politician
Dialogue: The Fifth Avenue Renovation Project, which I championed, will breath new life into the downtown area. New life means new jobs and new revenue.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Councilman, is it true that your brother-in-law's construction company won the contract for this project?

Speaker: politician
Dialogue: Well...er...yes, but...look I'm not here to answer a lot of crazy questions...

Speaker: young mother
Dialogue: Thank you! Thank you for saving me and my baby!

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: What's it feel like to be a hero?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Well...I'm just a man doing what men do. You're Roxanne Ritchi, aren't you?

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: Were you scared?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Scared? Who had time?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: John Cusack, huh? So all I have to do is have a cute puppy dog stare, be willing to make a fool of myself and - Oh, REMOVE BOTH MY BALLS.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Please, get a hold of yourself.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You're...you're.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I mean, excuse me?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I did have a boyfriend - until fairly recently.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I'm sorry - this is so surreal!

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Things were complicated. He was a man married to his work. There was...there was a lot of competition in his line of business. I'm sure you know what that's like.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: ...The body-builder who used to play The Hulk on TV?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Well...one rival in particular seemed to get more of his attention than I ever did. But enough about my problems.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Right, well, he seemed to need him more than he needed me.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: It was conflict he thrived on. He always said he wouldn't know what to do with himself if Master - I mean, this guy were gone. It was like he needed it, like oxygen.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I'd love that.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Got her nose!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I've got it!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I've got it!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: It's plain and simple. Extraordinary minds need extraordinary stimulation. Without that stimulus they wither and die. Therefore, there is only one logical conclusion: I must create a new superhero.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Yeah, maybe that's not such hot idea...

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Prepare for Operation Superhero Genesis!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Prepare the subject.

Speaker: severs
Dialogue: I feel fine. Just a little sticky, but aside from that everything's completely -

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Okay then.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: And this one?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: We attached gills to him. He can breath under water.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Ah. Does he have extraordinary strength?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Well...no.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Can he fly?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Resilient to weapons fire?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: He just breathes under water, then.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Ah...yeah.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Plato, the radioactive spider, please.

Speaker: stenwick
Dialogue: Ow!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Anything, Stenwick?

Speaker: stenwick
Dialogue: No. Ah...sir, I didn't know this was about spiders. I have a pretty severe case of arachnophobia.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: We're gonna need more venom.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: This has proven to be a challenge. I just don't know what I want. What do I want?

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Yeah, well, it sounds like what you want is Uberman.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: That's it! Why make a copy when the real thing will do?

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: I was just kidding, sir. In case you forgot, you actually burned Uberman alive.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Then we'll make a new one. Plato, bring me the box!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Behold - Uberessence. The very thing that gave Uberman his superhuman powers.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Where the hell did you get that?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Oh, I shot him with a power sucking gun and had this idea to use this to clone a whole army of evil Ubermen. I'm not sure why I never got around to following up with that.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: I believe he defeated you before you could, master.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: ...Right. Man, he was good!

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: You want another volunteer, sir?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Not another volunteer driven by the need for personal gain. Somebody else, somebody pure.

Speaker: news reporter
Dialogue: ...who risked his own life to save that of a young mother and her child.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Please, please, you're embarrassing me. I saw someone in need and I helped them. What more can we ask of ourselves. I ask you, what more?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Yeah, sir. This guy is a real piece of work. He used to teach bowling at Kingpin's.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: A modest profession to brilliantly hide his true heroic nature. I love it.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Then you are absolutely going to love this -

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: - He volunteers at a school for the blind.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: He volunteers. He doesn't ask for any reward for his deeds. The fates are shining down on me. This Mr. Stewart is truly an unselfish soul.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: You greedy little bastard. I already gave you a twenty.

Speaker: blind kid
Dialogue: Hey, you want me to play along? Then pay up, bitch!

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Fine, but you better be convincing.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Here she comes, go to work.

Speaker: blind kid
Dialogue: Why can't I see! Why God?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Hey, Peter. C'mon champ, let me look at you.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: You know, in life we're all given no more than we can bear. This happened to you maybe because you were meant to rise above it - Maybe to be an inspiration to the other little Peteys out there.

Speaker: blind kid
Dialogue: You really think so, Hal?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Hey, does it LOOK like I'm lying? Now c'mon, go feel your way to class before you get your little butt suspended.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Petey, wait a minute.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Don't run into anything!

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: I think I've seen enough, sir. This is your guy.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Oh, there it is again. This is really getting embarrassing now.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Oh, crap. You got me.

Speaker: attractive woman
Dialogue: Hey, you're on TV again.

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: This just in. Upon a second look at that tape from this morning, which we'll now replay for you, it appears it was not the heroic act it first seemed to be.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: I guess that looks kinda bad.

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: There he is, boss.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Now, we're sure this won't kill him?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Yes, sir. He'll just feel a slight electrical shock.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Slight electrical shock?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: God, I hate the weather in this city.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Follow him.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: You don't look so good, man.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: I don't feel good. I was struck by freaking lightening.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: No, you're just hallucinating. By the way, we're out of orange juice.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: AAAAAAHHHHH!

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Man...

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Wait!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Welcome to your second birth, Hal Stewart.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Who are you!?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: I am the guide on your journey. Fate has chosen you to be it's champion.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Thank God. It was a dream. Man, I must be losing it.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Jesus! This isn't happening, this isn't happening.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Bullshit! Sometimes it's best to freak out.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Look I'm gonna call the cops in about two seconds if you don't get out of here.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm okay.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: What the hell was that for?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Can you just tell me what this is all about?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: That's me alright.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: We're are we going?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: I'M LIFTING A FREAKING CAR!!!

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Yeah, work both muscles.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: What are you doing!?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Uh...yeah. I would prefer not to get shot. Do not fire that thing!

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Okay, do you know that for sure?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: You suck.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Ice Man, I got a bogie on my tail. Two Russian Migs coming in hard and fast.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: God, I feel so gay.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: YEEEE HAWWWW!

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: WHOOOOA! Man, that is so cool. It's like fly - Oh my God, I almost said it was like flying.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Why, where're ya going?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Say no more, bro. I'll just keep at it, then.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: How's your sandwich?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Hope you don't think I'm too forward. Some men are intimidated when a woman asks them out. I just find you really easy to talk to.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You know, you're not at all like you are in the movies.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Yeah. I don't know - You have this strange, refined way of speaking.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Anyway, when we were talking the other day I just felt, even though we only talked for a couple of hours, that we've known each other for years.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You know what? This sandwich is disgusting.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Thanks, but knowing me, I was probably projecting my expectations of what a lunch should be on the sandwich. It might have been okay at first, but I just made it bitter.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: When I look back, I probably shouldn't of expected so much from him. He was already a giving person. You know, one of those go out and save the world types.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I was selfish, I guess. I didn't want to share him with anybody else.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: They broke the mold.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: What's the "T" stand for?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: What's that supposed to mean?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: I don't think this mask is big enough. Are you sure no one is gonna recognize me?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Alright folks, this is a robbery. Nobody moves - yadda, yadda, yadda...

Speaker: george
Dialogue: The safe. Let's go.

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: Okay, just don't hurt anyone.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Well, boys, there's no need for all this just to get the free toaster.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What are you suppose to be?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Justice.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Well, justice, suck on this...

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Now it's my turn.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Well, Ringo...um...um...you're under arrest.

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: On behalf of the First National Bank of Metro City, I'd like to offer you a reward for your act of bravery.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Ten thousand dollars!

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: This story's mine.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Listen, Brad. We were just in the area. I was just trying to -

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: I've been in this business long enough to know pretty well what you were "just trying to do." Besides, I heard you couldn't take the big game anymore and were put on fluff detail?

Speaker: seth
Dialogue: You're not gonna take that from him, are you?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: He's right. Old habit, I guess.  We'll get out of your way.

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: Besides, I'm sure there's a pancake supper somewhere that needs covering.

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: For months now, since the death of Uberman, the citizens of Metro City have been holding out for a hero. Well, it appears they won't have to hold out for much longer as a new costumed crusader has suddenly stormed onto the scene. Today, at the Metro Savings and Trust, a masked mystery man single-handedly defeated "The Fab Four Gang." Just who is this new caped avenger?

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: I'm sure all of our viewers are now wondering, what's the "T" stand for?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: It's a message to all the scum out there. Uberman may be gone, but Metro City has a new protector, and his name is "Tighten!"

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: How do you spell that?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Oh, for heaven's sake. I can't believe it. He misspelled his name.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Yeah, if the plan is getting us in jail.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: You know, Einstein, maybe I should have called you Socrates. He also didn't know when to keep his thoughts to himself.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: I just fail to see the point in all of this. I mean, why are we creating another superhero when it was such a pain in the ass for you to get rid of the other one? I mean, Uberman is destroyed, we should be using this opportunity to...to...

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: To what?

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: I don't know. To take over the weather, space, the world - whatever super villains are SUPPOSED to do.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: The reason someone like you will always be a minion is because you have no foresight. We take over the earth, like you said. Then what? Women? Cars? Money? Even the grandest treasures will lose their lustre if you don't have someone to hold them over.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: That's it! This balance of the force bullshit is getting way too Oprah for me. I'm blowing. Who's with me?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: You dare?

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Yeah, I dare. I'm sick of wearing stupid costumes, and I'm sick of working for a super villain who's turning into a softie.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: What - did - you - call me?

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: You heard me. You used to be an inhuman monster, now look at you. You're creating super heroes, you don't go with us on robberies anymore, it's been days since you threatened anyone, oh, and not to mention this Roxanne Ritchi thing.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: THAT is none of your business, knave!

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Hey, you guys haven't sealed the deal yet, have you?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Silence!

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Oh, Master, your head is so big.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I'm warning you, Einstein.

Speaker: einstein
Dialogue: Take me!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I said silence!

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Don't get me wrong, I love being a reporter. I don't think I could do anything else. It's the consequences of what we do that I'm having a problem with.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: It's supposed to.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I got someone I cared about killed. If it wasn't for me, he wouldn't have been involved.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Was he an actor?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Jail?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Was he ever successful?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Thanks for this. You know, this is embarrassing, but it's been a long time since I -

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Oh, I was gonna say...It's been a long time since...well, I've been with someone I...enjoy being with.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Oh my God.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: You're not gonna get all freaky about this, are you?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: This...this is too much, even for you. God, I go out with you, tell you my innermost thoughts.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I only did this because I wanted to talk to you on the same level. You know, without all the baggage?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Baggage? You burned my boyfriend alive, you sick son-of-a-bitch!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: You see, that's exactly what I'm talking about.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Stay away from me.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Stupid. What was I thinking? Plato, it's his fault. He's the one who sent me on this weak-willed path. I'll filet his scrotum for this. Me, a creature of evil, in love with Roxanne Ritchi. Preposterous. I hardly give such matters thought

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I should just go up there and just lay it all out to her. "Roxanne, I like you - I always have. Oh, and I'm sorry I blew up your ex.  Yeah, that would go over like a pants-less clown at a child's birthday party. What the hell am I even doing here? Who cares what she thinks? I'm a supervillain and here I am acting like a love struck schoolboy. Forget this. I control my own destiny!

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Damn.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Please be open.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: A pack of Lady Strikes, please.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Hello, Triple A?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I'll call you back.

Speaker: shopkeeper
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: shotgun hoodlum
Dialogue: Shut up, Gramps.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: shotgun hoodlum
Dialogue: I said give it to me!

Speaker: shotgun hoodlum
Dialogue: What the hell's that? A super soaker?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: No, it's a goo gun.

Speaker: shotgun hoodlum
Dialogue: Yeah, what's it do?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: It goos.

Speaker: shopkeeper
Dialogue: I know you! You Master Brain guy. You a hero.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Don't - EVER - say that again.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Don't flatter yourself.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Don't walk away from me when I'm talking to you.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: My, someone has a rather high opinion of themselves.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Do you really think I would be with someone like you?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Everything alright, sir?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Fine, why do you ask?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: You...just...seem...

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: ...distracted.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Just with business, my minion. Just with business. I've decided it is time.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: You mean?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Yes, we've created our hero, now it's time to give him a little motivation.

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: How do we do that?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: To be simply good is not enough. A hero must be driven by an almost relentless desire to right a wrong that can never be corrected.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: You mean?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Yes, he must lose someone near and dear to him - his father figure. Gentlemen, it's time for Operation Mentor Kill!

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Man, what the hell happened down there? Wait a sec -

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Crap.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Master Mind? Why?

Speaker: reporter 1
Dialogue: Tighten, Is this the work of Master Mind?

Speaker: reporter 2
Dialogue: How will the death of your mentor affect your resolve?

Speaker: reporter 3
Dialogue: Was that Pat Morita?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: This injustice will not go unpunished. Master Mind, if you can hear me, Tighten is coming for you.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Alright, people, we don't have much time. Titan should be here any minute, so let's get the lead out.

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: Nearly up to full power, sir.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Hum. Let's turn it down a few notches. It's his first time and we don't want to get in a lucky shot, now do we?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Not yet, sir.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I see. Well, he must be planning something big. Are the flame androids deployed?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: All twelve.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Wonderful, wonderful. Plato, Da Vinci, take your places next to me.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: He's certainly taking his time.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: He'll be here. That's the way it works.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Oh, for crying out loud.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Do you know who I am?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Yeah, you're Master Mind. Yeah! You're actually the guy I want to see!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Oh, so NOW you want to get down to it. Well, I want to get a few things off my chest first.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Well, at first I was going to. You know, because that's what I figured I was supposed to do. But then I got to thinking-

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: -You got to thinking? There's nothing to think about. I'm the villain. I do something bad, you come and get me.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: - I got to thinking...what's the point?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Maybe you're right. What's the point?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: That's what I wanted to talk to you about.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Where did you get all this?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Get this: I stole them.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: From where?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: From all over. You see, once you killed Pat and ruined my other apartment building I was pretty pissed off, so I figured I'd go, find you and kick some ass. Then I thought to myself: "Okay,then what?" I mean, if we were to fight, what would I get out of it? Would I get my apartment back? Would I be able to pay the bills?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Well, what about your mentor?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Tell you the truth? He was kind of a dick. I mean, being a hero is dandy and all, but it's volunteer work. Now you've always had the right take on all this. I mean, when you rob a bank or take over the diamond exchange you get something out of it. I mean, when you don't get caught, which, no offense, isn't very often. And that brings me to what I wanted to propose to you: Who could catch you if I'm by your side?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: You want to team-up?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: You got the brains, I got the brawn. We could even call ourselves that: `Brain' and `Brawn'. Look at this.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: What do I think?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: I worked hard on this.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Oh - gee - I am so sorry!

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Now, hold on. You're going a little too far.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I wish your mother said that to your father the night of your conception, they would have saved me a whole lot of heartache.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Hey, I mean it.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Oh, yeah? What are you gonna do?

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: Master!

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: What hurts?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: It!

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: I don't need you, I don't need anybody. I have the power to do and take anything I want. And now, I'm gonna take back everything this city owes me. Beware Metro City, it's time for Titan to collect.

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: How'd the plan go, boss?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I just made myself redundant, old friend.

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: It's not that bad.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Morning, Tighten.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Morning.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Is there something we can do for you?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Oh, don't bother about me. I'm just here to make a withdrawal.

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: Say, did he just rob us?

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Not sure. Sort of looks it, don't it?

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Should I, you know, stop him?

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: Umm...Yeah.

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: "Absolute power corrupts absolutely." When Lord Acton stated that, in a letter to Bishop Mandell Creighton in 1887, no one thought much about it, but today Metro City is reeling from that very prophecy. Tighten, who many thought of as our savior, has turned his back on the cause of justice.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: I don't understand it. He seemed to have every characteristic we were looking for in a superhero.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Well, there's no use crying about it now, we must take action. I'm not going to play second fiddle to that crass buffoon. We must destroy Tighten.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: It won't be easy. Uberman had a sense of decency and genuine love for the people. That was his weakness and was easily used against him.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Yes, but he possesses the same flaws present in Uberman's DNA - copper. It's like Benjamin Franklin always said: "If something works don't dick with it."

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: I can have anything I want. I'm like a god.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Point to any woman in this bar. I could have her in a second.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Hey, you wanna get with this?

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Buddy, what do you want?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: What do you want? That's the question, isn't it. I mean, what do you want when you can have everything?  I suppose what I really want is to never be forgotten again. I want to do something that can never be cast aside or one-upped. I want a - what's it called? - A legacy. I want a legacy. Yeah, that's it. I like the sound that.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: I meant, what do you want to drink?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: There can be only one master criminal in this city - and it's me.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I have a better idea - NOW!

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: You know what? You're nothing but a bug. Not even worth my effort.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: He's not as dumb as I thought.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: I guess not...Funny, though.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: What's funny?

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: Funny Uberman didn't think of the same thing.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: That's it!

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Hello, Legacy.

Speaker: vinnie
Dialogue: Hey, that's my ball!

Speaker: elderly woman
Dialogue: That was a close one. Sixth floor, please.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Wow, I always thought Uberman was your first superhero - but it looks like our little Roxanne dated a linebacker in college.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: That's my diary.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: So it is.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: It's personal.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Well, then I wouldn't leave it in your underwear drawer for just anyone to find.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I need your help.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: So you knock me out and tie me to a chair?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: You're not going to like what I'm about to tell you.

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: It's chaos here in city square as city police -

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: He's really out of control.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Tell me about it.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I should have known. You have something to do with this, don't you? - With Titan turning evil.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Well, the evil thing he did by himself. My goal was to give MYSELF purpose by creating an intellectual sparring partner.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You're talking like you made him.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: And they call me Master Mind.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Let me get this straight. You missed getting your ass kicked, so you made a new guy to kick your ass. That's pathetic.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: In hindsight...

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: And his powers, they're just like Uberman's. Why would he have his powers?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I had some left over from something. I infused him with it.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: YOU DID WHAT!?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Yeah, that's why I decided to tie you up.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You did all this because you wanted purpose?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: He seemed nice.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Closer. I want to show the people my real face.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Hal Stewart. He's the guy we thought saved that woman and kid. Turned out he was just trying to save his own ass.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Yeah, good to know - NOW!

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: That's right, I'm really Hal Stewart. Former hero and bowling teacher at Kingpin's Bowling.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You picked a bowler to give super powers to?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: It's a modest profession!

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: With my new found power, I've recently started to wonder what sort of legacy I should leave. Should I be a hero? I tried that once before - even saved a lady and her baby from being squashed. I was treated like a god until everyone started to shit on me - Okay, so what if I didn't "purposely" save them!

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Well, I'm going to make something that can't be taken away from me. I'm going to create a permanent monument to my greatness. One that won't be so easily forgotten or erased.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: I intend to create a new category in the Guinness Book of World's Records by rolling the biggest strike in the history of bowling.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: My thanks to the city planning commission. This wouldn't have been possible without them.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Tell your friends and family to tune in right here to this station at noon tomorrow.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: My god, he's nuts. That'll destroy the whole business triangle.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: My lair is in the direct path of the ball.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Oh, real nice. Wouldn't want anything to happen to your hideout, would we?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: You don't understand. I have certain equipment that's - that's highly unstable.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I sort of have a hydrogen reactor, okay?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: A HYDROGEN reactor?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: It's experimental - only one in the world...Well, how do you think I power all my inventions? Someone like me can't pay for electricity. The bills would be outrageous.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: A REACTOR?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: It creates 100 times the output of a nuclear one...If destroyed it could...

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: - Vaporize the entire city!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I mean...we'd better find a way to stop him.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Did Uberman have a hideout?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: A cave, a solitary fortress of some kind. C'mon, all heros have a place to hang their capes up in. Roxanne, it may be our only chance to find something, a clue, anything that could give us a fighting chance.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: It's under his house.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Whose house?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Wayne Scott's.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Wayne Scott? Uberman was Wayne Scott!? Wayne Scott, the wealthy philanthropist? But he disappeared -

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: He disappeared just over two months ago when you killed him. Not only did you rid the world of a hero, you killed a kind, noble, generous man.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: "Metro City doomed." You know, I never thought I'd say something like this, but here it goes -

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Such a dark place for one such as you. I wonder, underneath your noble deeds, what inner demons drove you to your endless crusade for justice?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Good lord, man. You've only been dead for two months.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Ahhhhhh!

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: Jesus!

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I might just ask you the same question. I had thought I incinerated you.

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: You scared the bejesus out of me. How'd you figure out I was still alive? Wait, how do you know my identity!?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Roxanne told me. As for your ruse, I forgot to line the bottom of the copper cage - Somebody pointed that out to me recently. Figured if they could do it, so could you. But one thing I couldn't figure out -

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: The skeleton? Something I "borrowed" from a medical school a few months before.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: A few months? How long had you been planning this?

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: I always planned to retire - eventually. I mean, come on, you can't do this sort of thing in your fifties. You'd just look ridiculous.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I see it all so clearly now.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: Man, you ARE smart.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: But why fake your death? Why go through all of it? You could have just quit.

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: But the responsibility would still be there.  A cop can retire and stop handing out speeding tickets - but people expect more from superheroes. I tell you, a volcano couldn't erupt in Zimbabwe without everyone expecting me to do something about it. I figured, out of sight, out of mind.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: And Wayne Scott? Why did he have to disappear?

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: Both of my lives have so much baggage. It's time for new baggage, you know?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I just can't believe it. This whole time you've been in hiding while a force of great evil is tearing your city apart?

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: I don't want to hear about it. That's why I don't have a television in here to remind me of all the things I SHOULD be doing. Hell, I could get a wife to do that.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: There's a demented supervillain out there about to destroy our - I mean, your city.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: You're really going to do nothing?

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: Good and evil have a way of balancing themselves out. If this guy is as bad as you say, somebody will rise up to fight him. It's just the order of things. You found me, didn't you?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: You're the only one who can stop him.

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: Couldn't if I wanted to. Gotta a plane to catch.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: A plane?

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: Going to Barbados for a little change in climate. Now, if you'll excuse me, I got to go pack.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Not smart enough to come up with a full-proof trap.

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: Well, you did almost have me when you figured out my weakness was copper. Now that made me sweat a little. Took me way too long to drill out from under that cage.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I got lucky.

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: Anyway, it's a good thing for my sake that I could always count on you for an out.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: C'mon, we always threw each other a couple of bones. You would always leave me an out in one of your `full-proof' traps, and I'd never had you incarcerated at a penitentiary that you couldn't eventually escape from. It kept our little game going.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Game? - Was that all this ever was to you? You know, I was trying my best every time I fought you. Those `outs' as you call them were unintentional.

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I guess I was never really a match for you, was I?

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: I think we both got what we wanted out of our relationship. She got a career out of me, and I got plenty of other things out of her. But I'm ready to move on to greener pastures.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I guess I wasn't the villain I thought I was, and you...you weren't the hero I thought you were.

Speaker: wayne scott
Dialogue: Roxanne! How long have you been...

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Long enough.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Alright, I want this whole thing to look ESPN professional, understand?

Speaker: tank loudspeaker
Dialogue: Titan, we have orders from the city of Metro to take you into custody. If you do not give your self up willingly, we will be forced to open fire.

Speaker: tank loudspeaker
Dialogue: What is your answer?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Miss me?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Guys, please tell me you got that last bit.

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: You're kidding me. I give you my sexiest moves and you mean to tell me it was for nothing?

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: We were afraid something might hit us.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Looks like I've given the story of the century to the wrong man.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Wait. What about that other reporter. Blond. Not so lumpy on the topper half, but killer legs.

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: Roxanne. You want Roxanne. She's a much better reporter than I am. You want her.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Where can I find her.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: We're actually not supposed to give out that sort of information.

Speaker: brad helms
Dialogue: 1314 Mockingbird Lane. I believe she lives in a penthouse.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: You've been very helpful.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Hurry, we must be on our way as soon as possible.

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: Master, why must we flee?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I told you, Titan is too powerful. If he's set on destroying us, there's precious little we could do about it.

Speaker: da vinci
Dialogue: Where are we going?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: To another city, someplace with a shitload of superheroes to fight. We'll start over, we'll go back to doing what we do best.

Speaker: plato
Dialogue: With our tails between our legs?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Plato, do you have a better plan?!

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: What are you going to do about Tighten?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Right now I'm packing, later I'll have a snack on the train.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You're running away?

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: In a word - yes.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You created this monster...

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I didn't create this - the god's of irony did and I am eating the crow I so richly deserve.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: There's no time for self pity.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I'll make the time.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I'm not going anywhere.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Will you listen to me, no one can stop him.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You have to try. The city needs your help.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: I'm afraid you have an inflated opinion of me.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: What the hell's happened to you? The Master Mind I knew would never have run from a fight even though he knew deep in his heart that he didn't have a chance in hell of winning it. It was your best quality. You need to be that man right now...I...

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I believe in you.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Sweet words, but that man is dead. Please, Roxanne, just come with me.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: No...I guess you are a coward after all.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Man, have I got a story for you.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Roxanne? Roxanne?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: What pose would be best? The corny folded arms thing?

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Or maybe on the hips, like this.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: No, makes me look like a flamer pirate.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Shouldn't we be making a run for it right about now?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: The guy can outrun bullets. I don't think either one of us is in that kind of shape.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: She's right, Frank.

Speaker: titan
Dialogue: Also got super hearing. I promise not to keep the both of you long, but you'll thank me when this is all over.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Dad, it's me...  ...Bubsy. I know we haven't talked in a while, and I'm sorry. It's been a little crazy trying to live up to a legacy.

Speaker: master mind
Dialogue: Anyway...You raised me to be the worst that I could possibly be. And I've tried to live up to that as best as I could - even dropping out of dentistry school like you wanted me to.
